column4: hi, just booted my Desktop machine (running Hoary_64). during boot says that it cannot access hardware clock... (Hmm, OK I thought)
Now I cannot log in either, does not accept my password
is the bios clock used somehow when hashing a password?
well time changes so getting the same hash again would be impossible
which password[s]  are you wondering about?
My login to the machine
most hashing methods do not produce a blank hash for a blank input and many will use a salt sometimes based on the username so two users with the same password will have a different hash
is the issue you forgot your password?
forgot password? No
good thing I made a backup then
via Knoppix
are you sure you weren't editing the knoppix pass file?
yes I am
perhaps Ubuntu and Knoppix use different hashing algs
true
did you try and make a user on knoppix and copy the line to your other file?
I think it'd be better use use a Ubuntu Live CD for this rather than Knoppix if you can
not yet
can we dcc?
gotcha! But does md5hash use the hardware clock when it hashes a password...just seems strange that both issues occur at the same time
hat I am trying to say does the algorhythm(sp) use clock cycles to generate the hash
NO it does NOT use the clock
thanks
md5 is for making a hash that is reproducable same input will always make the same output and clock cycles wouldn't be very good because then the passwords would bever work
